column1: 52$Bipolar Depression$5/22/2012 12:41:46 AM$Reviewer: flower
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$3$Invaga worked for me the first two months  Then just recently I gained weight in my abdomen area real fast and am suffering other side effets. They are extreme fatigue
column3: feeling anxious
column4: very worried
column8: blurry vision and frequent urination. I am not sure why this has occured. I am going through a really hard time also. My father is not feeling good at times and I get so upset cause he is very important to me. Also my hus band says he will be leaving me to go home to his country which will leave me in charge of finances and a new place to live. They say stress can cause depression. I am seeking the help of my psychologist and my aunts
column11: Uncle and my sister.  I think also my sleep schedule is off. I don't go to bed until real late and sleep in alot. The weight gain from the invega worries me the most its about 40 pounds. My doctor told me Invega is not a weight gaining drug and that is not true bcause I WAS VERY THIN IN THE BEGINNING. My husband puts me down cause of my weight and that makes me depressed. I really was doing better when I was fourty pounds less. I had more energy then. But that was also before I got the news of my Dads serious condition and my husband saying hes leaving in the future. Im going to review the effectiveness of Invega and side effects with my Pschiatrist as soon as possible. I have appointment on June  6.

column1: 56$Bipolar Depression$1/30/2012 8:38:31 AM$Reviewer: doinmybest
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$This medication is a life saver for me. It controls my deep
column3: dark depressions
column4: paranoia
column5: and delusions. I was initially taking Risperdal
column6: which caused me to develop tremors.  Invega provides me with the same results as Risperdal without the side effect of tremors. I was initially taking 6 mg a day but started to suffer from mood swings and paranoia. I am currently on 9 mg and am doing fantastic. I am very pleased with the effects of this medication and would recommend it to anyone suffering from bipolar disorder. I initially gained 20 lb while taking it but I am now carefully watching what I eat and exercising and the weight is slowly coming off.

column1: 158$Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$3/30/2008 5:22:03 PM$Reviewer: Dennis
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $2$2$3$When I first started taking this medicine I was extremely anxious. I noticed a twitching in my toes and fingers. This minor twitching has continued for the 6 months I have been on it.  I could not sleep when I first started taking it
column3: but was hospitalized for 5 days because I couldn't sleep. I had a tough time trying to get to sleep and when I finally did sleep I sweated greatly!  The sleep problems went away and my behavior was fine for about 5 1/2 months. Now the sleep problems are startng again.  It seems I have slight problems breating and the tingling /twithching in my toes and feet are more severe.  I get real thirsty and drink lots of water.  It as if the systems in my body are shutting down and adrenalin is being pumped into my blood to keep my systems going which in turn keeps me awake.  The drug seems to calm me down but only for a short period of time after taking it. They just uped me from 6 mg to 9mg two days ago.  We will see how it goes.

93$Mania associated with Bipolar Disorder$11/4/2009 3:10:54 PM$Reviewer: Posh_posha
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$4$This drug has effectively treated my mania and has seemed to have given me some balance and clarity psychologically. I'm not paranoid and my thoughts are not racing at all. I was on abilify
column3: and I went out of the range of abilify and fell into a manic phase for several months. To say the least it was horrible. My current doctor put me on invega and I like the fact that I seem to be more sound and not manic or paranoid. However
column4: now I am very sluggish and lazy. I feel depressed and I have gained a lot of weight.  My body just seems to me weighed down all the time. I also easily get indigestion now. I am also lacking focus and have a terrible time doing basic tasks like getting dressed of doing the laundry. I take it in the morning along with an anti-anxiety medication. I'm going to talk to my doctor about all of the side effects that I am experiencing to see if there is another medicine out there for me. It would be great if I could find a drug that gave me the balance and clarity of invega and the pep that I got from abilify. I had no weight gain when I was on abilify.
